words.definition: If something is archaic, it is very old or outdated.
words.example: To many people, the typewriter is an archaic machine.

words.definition: If someone is benevolent, they are kind and generous.
words.example: The benevolent man gave a lot of money to the hospital.

words.definition: Brass is a yellowish metal made by mixing copper and zinc.
words.example: The door handle was made of shiny brass.

words.definition: Capitalism is an economic system where industries are owned by individuals.
words.example: Many countries in the world have a system of capitalism.

words.definition: A component is a part that makes up a larger machine or system.
words.example: The computer has many different components.

words.definition: Dependence is the state of needing someone or something for help.
words.example: The babyâ€™s dependence on its mother is very high.

words.definition: To diminish something means to make it smaller or less important.
words.example: The sound of the music diminished as we walked away.

words.definition: A drawback is a disadvantage or a negative feature.
words.example: The only drawback of the new car is that it is very expensive.

words.definition: A fad is something that is popular for a short time.
words.example: The new hairstyle was a fad that only lasted for a few months.

words.definition: To impose something means to force it on other people.
words.example: The government imposed a new tax on cigarettes.

words.definition: Managerial describes something related to a manager or management.
words.example: She has a managerial position at the bank.

words.definition: If something is medieval, it relates to the Middle Ages.
words.example: The castle was a beautiful piece of medieval architecture.

words.definition: If something is obsolete, it is no longer needed because something better exists.
words.example: Cassette tapes became obsolete after CDs were invented.

words.definition: A peninsula is a piece of land that is surrounded by water on three sides.
words.example: The country of Italy is a peninsula.

words.definition: Prestige is the honor or respect that someone gets from others.
words.example: The doctor had a lot of prestige in the community.

words.definition: A proportion is a part of a larger whole.
words.example: A large proportion of the students passed the test.

words.definition: If something is radical, it is very new and different from what is traditional.
words.example: The company made some radical changes to its business plan.

words.definition: To refute something means to prove that it is wrong or false.
words.example: The scientist refuted the theory with new evidence.

words.definition: If something is spectacular, it is very impressive to look at.
words.example: The fireworks display was absolutely spectacular.

words.definition: To weave means to make cloth or other objects by crossing threads over and under each other.
words.example: The woman wove a beautiful basket from dried grass.
